canonical_views.user_story: As an end user, I want to register for the application using a valid email address and password so that I can create a personal account and securely access the system’s task management features.
preconditions: Given the user is on the application landing page
actions: When the user clicks on the "Sign Up" option
And provides a valid email address and a password meeting minimum security requirements
outcomes: Then the system creates a new user account
And POST /api/auth/signup returns HTTP 201
And the user sees a confirmation message stating "Account created"
And the user is redirected to the login page

canonical_views.user_story: As a registered user, I want to log in using my email and password so that I can securely access my personal dashboard and manage my tasks.
preconditions: Given the user is on the login page
actions: When the user enters valid credentials
outcomes: Then POST /api/auth/login returns HTTP 200 with an authentication token
And the user is redirected to the User Dashboard

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want the dashboard to clearly indicate when I have no tasks so that I understand the current state of my account and am encouraged to create my first task.
preconditions: Given the user has no tasks associated with their account
actions: When the user logs in successfully
outcomes: Then the dashboard displays the message "No tasks found. Create your first!"

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want to create a new task by providing a task title so that I can track and manage my activities effectively within the application.
preconditions: Given the user is logged in and on the dashboard
actions: When the user submits a valid task title
outcomes: Then POST /api/tasks returns HTTP 201
And the task is saved with the user's identifier
And the task appears in the Active Tasks list

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want to modify the title of an existing task so that I can correct mistakes or reflect updated requirements.
preconditions: Given the user owns a task titled "Buy groceries"
actions: When the user edits the task title to "Buy organic groceries"
outcomes: Then PUT /api/tasks/{taskId} returns HTTP 200
And the updated title is reflected immediately in the UI

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want to mark a task as completed so that I can distinguish finished work from pending tasks.
preconditions: Given the user has an active task
actions: When the user marks the task as completed
outcomes: Then the task status is updated to "completed"
And the task is moved to the Completed Tasks section

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want to permanently delete a task so that I can remove tasks that are no longer relevant.
preconditions: Given the user initiates deletion of a task
actions: When the user confirms the deletion
outcomes: Then DELETE /api/tasks/{taskId} returns HTTP 200
And the task is removed from the dashboard
And a confirmation message "Task deleted" is displayed

canonical_views.user_story: As a user, I want the system to restrict access strictly to my own tasks so that my personal data remains private and secure.
preconditions: Given the user manually alters the task URL to reference another user's task
outcomes: Then the API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden
And the UI displays an error message indicating insufficient permissions

canonical_views.user_story: As an administrator, I want to log in to the system so that I can access administrative features within the scope of my assigned privileges.
actions: When the admin logs in with valid credentials
outcomes: Then the Admin Dashboard loads successfully

canonical_views.user_story: As an admin, I want full create, read, update, and delete access to my own tasks so that I can manage my responsibilities independently.
preconditions: Given the admin is logged in
outcomes: Then the admin can create, edit, complete, and delete tasks owned by the admin account

canonical_views.user_story: As an admin, I want to view a list of users in a read-only format so that I can see system users without being able to modify their details.
preconditions: Given the admin opens the Users tab
And edit and delete actions are disabled
And a tooltip indicates "View only – Contact Super Admin for changes"

canonical_views.user_story: As an admin, I should be prevented from changing user roles so that role-based security and hierarchy are maintained.
actions: When the admin attempts to update a user's role
outcomes: Then PUT /api/users/{userId}/role returns HTTP 403

canonical_views.user_story: As an admin, I should not be allowed to access or manipulate tasks belonging to other users so that ownership boundaries are enforced.
actions: When the admin queries tasks for a different user
outcomes: Then the API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden
And the admin’s task list remains unchanged

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to log in to the system so that I can perform unrestricted administrative
preconditions: Given a super admin account exists
actions: When the super admin logs in
outcomes: Then the Global Dashboard is displayed

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to view global statistics across all users and tasks so that I have complete visibility into system usage.
As a super admin, I want to view tasks belonging to any user so that I can monitor and manage activity across the entire system.
actions: When the super admin calls GET /api/tasks
outcomes: Then tasks from all users are returned

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to filter tasks by individual users so that I can focus on specific accounts when required.
actions: When the super admin selects a specific user
outcomes: Then GET /api/tasks?user_id={id} returns only that user’s tasks

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to update any user’s task so that I can correct issues or enforce system-level changes.
actions: When the super admin updates a task
outcomes: Then the task is updated successfully
And task history records "Updated by Super Admin"

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to promote or demote users so that administrative responsibilities are correctly assigned.
actions: When the super admin updates a user role
outcomes: Then PUT /api/users/{userId}/role returns HTTP 200
And the new role is applied immediately

canonical_views.user_story: As a super admin, I want to archive users so that inactive or removed accounts are properly deactivated along with their tasks.
actions: When the super admin archives a user
outcomes: Then the user status is set to "deleted"
And all associated tasks are archived
